reply_html:
Test reply, engage!

On Mon, Mar 10, 2025 at 8:52 PM Barbara Pigg <barbara@wb-mailers.com> wrote:
Hey Lance Instantly20250311014754,

Word has it that one of Whiteboard Geeks' latest creations—a business card carrying a video message —has ended its epic journey to you via good old snail mail! It’s tiny but mighty, packed with some awesome Back to the Future references and fun illustrations that I hope break through the sea of regular mail. Tracking says it was delivered on 2/27 to Richmond, VA .

Did it land on your desk in all its mini glory, or is it moonlighting as a coffee coaster? Either way, I’d love to hear what you think of the video as well as card itself and how Whiteboard Videos could fit into the strategy at InstantlyTest or is it ?

I’ll be sending over an invite soon to chat through your thoughts, and I’d love a few minutes of your time to brainstorm how we can help your team with some fresh visual storytelling. If my suggestion doesn't work, feel free to propose a better day/time!

Looking forward to e-meeting you soon. As a bonus, I'll send over a fun, hand-drawn virtual background for our Zoom call—just for showing up!

P.S. If that video card got lost in a mysterious USPS black hole, let me know and we’ll happily send another. We know how tricky hybrid schedules can be!



--


WhiteboardGeeks.com | lance@whiteboardgeeks.com
